text: The 1997 LPGA Championship was the 43rd LPGA Championship, played May 15–18 at DuPont Country Club in Wilmington, Delaware. Christa Johnson won her only major title in a sudden-death playoff over Leta Lindley. The win came with a par on the second extra hole, after both had players bogeyed the first. Johnson and Lindley were co-leaders after 54 holes. It was the first playoff at the LPGA Championship since 1970, then a full 18-hole round on Monday. This was the fourth of eleven consecutive LPGA Championships at DuPont Country Club. ==Past champions in the field== ===Made the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- | align=left|Laura Davies || align=left| || 1994, 1996 || 67 || 75 || 74 || 68 || 284 || E || T4 |- | align=left|Pat Bradley || align=left| || 1986 || 70 || 75 || 76 || 67 || 288 || +4 || T11 |- | align=left|Kelly Robbins || align=left| || 1995 || 73 || 74 || 74 || 67 || 288 || +4 || T11 |- | align=left|Meg Mallon || align=left| || 1991 || 72 || 76 || 73 || 70 || 291 || +7 || T22 |- | align=left|Nancy Lopez || align=left| || 1978, 1985, 1989 || 69 || 79 || 78 || 68 || 294 || +10 || T37 |- | align=left|Betsy King || align=left| || 1992 || 76 || 73 || 77 || 70 || 296 || +12 || T53 |- | align=left|Jane Geddes || align=left| || 1987 || 73 || 73 || 79 || 74 || 299 || +15 || T67 |} Source: ===Missed the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || Total || To par |- | align=left|Jan Stephenson || align=left| || 1982 || 72 || 79 || 151 || +9 |- | align=left|Sally Little || align=left| || 1980 || 74 || 78 || 152 || +10 |- | align=left|Patty Sheehan || align=left| || 1983, 1984, 1993 || 76 || 76 || 152 || +10 |- | align=left|Sherri Turner || align=left| || 1988 || 74 || 79 || 153 || +11 |} Source: *Beth Daniel (1990) did not play ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, May 18, 1997 {|class="wikitable" !
